entry.title: VyOS - OSPF Basic Network
entry.summary: The following OSPF Network will be dissected within the length of this post: Diagram Network consists of 5 VyOS-powered routers, from which 4 connect to a central switch to which send all OSPF-related communication. R4, will be the exiting leg of the network into EDGE-RT, which will be the Autonomous System Border Router (ASBR) and redistribute the access towards the Internet within the OS...

entry.title: VyOS - Basic SOHO Set-Up
entry.summary: The purpose of this Blog Post is to detail a brief overview in a simplistic SOHO Network, with a VyOS powered Firewall/Router as Internet Gateway to cover basics of VyOS. VyOS is an Open-Source Router will Firewall capacilities which is based under Linux/GNU Operating System. Due to being based in Linux, many UNIX/BSD-Commands are completely compatible, making this an excellent option in ...

entry.title: Vulnserver HTER - Vanilla BOF & Character Conversion

link.title: Vulnserver HTER - Vanilla BOF & Character Conversion

entry.summary: Introduction In order to finish with the eccentric cases that vulnserver may offer us, today we will be seeing an odd case of a buffer overflow with a character conversion. The issue itself Due to the character conversion, the received bytes are parsed as expected. Nonetheless, the alphanumeric bytes suffer from no change whatsoever and are not ported as hex. For example, if the EIP is overf...

entry.title: Vulnserver LTER - SEH Extremely restricted character set

link.title: Vulnserver LTER - SEH Extremely restricted character set

entry.summary: Introduction Last time i blogged, we tackled aligning registers within windows exploit development. Today we will be seeing an example on the vulnerable server by stephen bradshaw, in which, a restricted set of characters may be found. entry.title: Alignments on Windows Registers
entry.summary: Preamble Welcome once again to my website! Within this post, i will be introducing methods to align x86 registers on Windows, topic that was hard for me to find when starting regarding Binary Exploitation.
